title: Which is the best keyboard (piano) to buy under ₹10,000 in India? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is very little point in buying a <10,000 piano. See, after a while you’ll need a better instrument because your skills would keep developing and a cheap model just won’t do. I recommend Casio CTK-6300IN. While some people prefer Yamaha over Casio, Casio is what I have used and I can testify that it’s a very decent instrument for both beginners and intermediate players. The best course of action is going to a music store and getting one which feels right playing. However, if you’re really serious about playing the piano, wait till you can triple your current budget and go for an 88-key, weighted key model, as that’s similar to a real grand piano.

I have been using Yamaha PSR e343. I found best for beginners. it might be approx 11 in market now. It has 3 year warranty. Below are the best i got from keyboard: Piano sound is good comparable to CTK of CasioTouch Sensitive keys( 3 levels)- Best in the price.Strings sounds quite armature but it’s ok.Sustain On will give you best arrangements for playing solo in piano mode.Registry memory( Up to 9 Songs)Affects- Reverb, echo, chores etc.1 key to access Grand piano.Good number of voices.Aux in to play KaraokeSupports Syntesia or few DAW software as well. (Experimented and proved)
